intro: Gnaphalium saturejoides var. vargasianum, commonly known as the Vargasian everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and dense, woolly foliage. The plant is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its small stature and ability to survive in harsh climates make it an interesting subject for botanical study. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in some regions.
